Here you can backup and restore the database. Make sure your database is backed up frequently. Click on Create Backup to manually backup your database. The backups are stored in the [/admin/backups/] folder and can be downloaded from the list below. Your most recent backup is highlighted. Once you create backup, make sure you download it, and delete the rest.
Are you sure you want to restore this backup?
This action can not be undone.
Here you can perform site maintenance, such as deleting inctive and banned users. Be careful what you doing, these actions can not be undone

This will delete all users (not administrators), who have not logged in to the site within a certain time period. It will not delete users pending verification proccess. Specify the number of inactive days from above.
This will delete all [TOTAL] banned user(s).
This empty cart data, used to store temporary user details.
Here you can update your system configuration. Please do not make any changes unless you know what you're doing.
The name of your web site, which is displayed in various locations across your site
Enter your currency such as CAD, USD, EUR
Enter your currency symbol such as $, €, £.
Directory where CMS pro is installed
Insert full URL WITHOUT any trailing slash (e.g. http://www.yourdomain.com)
This is the main email notices will be sent to. It is also used as the from 'email' when emailing other automatic emails
Add your company address, business info etc...
Invoice note displayed at footer section.
Illegal file type. Only jpg and png file types allowed.
If no logo exists, Website Name will be used instead
Default number of items used for pagination
Thumbnail Width/Height in px, used for resizing images such as user avatars.
If Yes users will need to confirm their email address and go through activation process.

Mail server port ( Can be 25, 26. 465 for GMAIL. 587 for Yahoo ). Ask your host if uncertain.
Choose Yes if your server requires SSL connection
Ask your hosting company for sandmail path if unsure. Usually: /usr/sbin/sendmail -t -i

Protecting pages based on user login
Here you can find instructions on how to protect your pages based on user level, login state etc..

First start by creating a new php page that you want to give access to all of your registered users. Let's call this page for the purpose of this tutorial reg_only_users.php. At the very beginning of the page start by adding following php code.

Make sure that init.php point to correct directory. For example, If your reg_only_users.php page is in the same directory as main script, than no changes are necessary, otherwise you need to enter correct path to your init.php page. Depending where you placed reg_only_users.php page, below or above root directory init.php becomes ../init.php if below the root or otherdir/init.php if above the root. Now let's add some protection

The two new lines of code do login verification. First line checks if user is not logged in, the second one redirects user to login page login.php. Now you can continue to add the usual html or php code to your page. In this example we protected single page using login verification process. If user is not logged in we redirect to login page, otherwise, we let the user view the page.

By default when user logs in, it will be redirected to profile page. You can change this behavior by redirecting user to any page of your choice. First start by creating a new php page that you want to redirect user on successful login. Let's call this page for the purpose of this tutorial redirect_page.php. Open up index.php page in root directory and look for:

Replace account.php with your new redirect page redirect_page.php Make sure that redirect_page.php point to correct directory. For example, If your redirect_page.php page is in the same directory as main script, than no changes are necessary, otherwise you need to enter correct path to your redirect_page.php page. Depending where you placed redirect_page.php page, below or above root directory redirect_page.php becomes ../redirect_page.php if below the root or otherdirectory/redirect_page.php if above the root. Now you can continue to add the usual html or php code to your page. If you need to protect this page using valid membership, follow instructions from Help Section. In this example on successful login, we redirected user to our custom page.
Protecting pages based on user membership

You can also use an automated page builder from here Page Builder. First start by creating a new php page that you want to give access to all of your registered users. Let's call this page for the purpose of this tutorial members_only.php. At the very beginning of the page start by adding following php code:

Make sure that init.php point to correct directory. For example, If your members_only.php page is in the same directory as main script, than no changes are necessary, otherwise you need to enter correct path to your init.php page. Depending where you placed members_only.php page, below or above root directory init.php becomes ../init.php if below the root or otherdir/init.php if above the root. Now let's add some protection:

The two new lines of code do membership verification. First line checks if user belongs to memberships 3 or 4, the second one redirects user to login page login.php. Note you can find out membership id from Manage Memberships very first column on the left.

Now you can continue to add the usual html or php code to your page. In this example we protected single page using membership verification process. If user does not have valid membership in this case 3 or 4 we redirect to login page, otherwise, we let the user view the page
Another example would be to show customized error message if user does not have valid membership.
We only used two memberships in this case 3 and 4. You can add multiple memberships separated by coma such as $user->checkMembership("2,3,4,5").

Membership Manager Pro is equipped with cron job utility. By default there are two files inside /cron/ directory cron_job0days.php and cron_job7days.php cron_job0days.php will automatically send emails to all users whose membership had expired at the present day, while cron_job7days.php will send emails to all users whose membership is about to expire within 7 days.
Here you can build your own custom protected page based on a user membership

Your new page will be created inside uploads/ directory. System assumes that you will be placing this page within the root of your initial install, and therefore all the paths and the necessary files will be included inside the page structure. Otherwize you will need to manualy adjust paths inside this page if you are placing it outside your MMP directory.
This is the actual file name of the page. You can name it anything you want, such as platinum_members
If yes default header and footer will be added to this page. You can always manually modify this page content later.
There was an error creating [NAME] Make sure your uploads directory is writable!

Use one of your existing pages just make sure that file extension is php. Let's call this page for the purpose of this tutorial login.php. At the very beginning of the page start by adding following php code.

Make sure that init.php point to correct directory. For example, If your login.php page is in the same directory as main script, than no changes are necessary, otherwise you need to enter correct path to your init.php page. Depending where you placed login.php page, below or above root directory init.php becomes ../init.php if below the root or otherdir/init.php if above the root.

in the above we have to redirects depending on user login state. The first one redirect_to() checks if user is already logged in. If it is, redirect to default account.php page. Second redirect_to() will redirect user to account.php page if login is successful. Just make sure that SITEURL . "/account.php" points to default account.php page. You can replace SITEURL with actual url like "http://yourdomain.com/mmp_directory/account.php"

The last piece is the actual login form. Nothing fancy, just username/password and submit button. You can modify login form in any way you want just make sure that input field/button names are exactly the same.
Membership period must be numeric value!

Period before membership expires. Valid values are: Day(s) Allowable range is 1 to 90 Week(s) Allowable range is 1 to 52 Month(s) Allowable range is 1 to 24 Year(s) Allowable range is 1 to 5"

Four different User Statuses are available: Active User - will be able to login and perform actions allowed to Registered Users. Inactive User - will not be able to login, unless Administrator approves user account. Banned User - upon login will receive an error message letting user know, that their account is currently banned. Pending User - will not be able to login until email verification process is completed.
We are sorry, selected username does not exist in our database
Username Is Too Short (less Than 4 Characters Long).
Sorry, This Username Is Already Taken
